ai.summary: A short, easy walk along the Balloan – Lairg Core Path in the UK, covering about 1.2 km of accessible, well-surfaced trail suitable for families and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features flat to gently undulating ground on a well-maintained gravel/dirt core path. Expect a smooth surface with occasional grassy edges and scenic rural views; overall easy for most walkers.
ai.safety_notes: This is a short, rural trail. Check weather and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Carry water and a basic map or GPS. Tell someone your plans if walking alone. Stay on the path, watch for uneven surfaces, and be mindful of livestock or other natural hazards. In wet conditions the track can become muddy and slippery.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight boots
Map or offline GPS and a charged mobile phone
Sun protection in sunny weather (hat, sunscreen)
Lightweight rain jacket and a small backpack
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and summer; be prepared for changing weather in autumn and winter.
